text:
Embedded forms can be customized with details in the link below. Basically some things look like the global events but are to be used outside of HubSpot when you embed the code.
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>

Hey everyone, I was wondering if anyone could help me. I recently created 2 new custom objects and I want to associate them with already existing companies and deals. Do you know if there is a way to do this in bulk? (for example; when I import a list of new contacts into HubSpot it automatically associates them with a company through the company domain name). I am a data scientist so i know somethings about code, but I have never worked with http posts/requests etc, that is why I am a bit lost. Hope you can help!

I'd highly encourage using one of HubSpot's language-specific API clients; I'm partial to the python one. Helps a lot with rate limit factors and the like.

Check out the language specific tabs in the API documentation, and play with the test values to help build your requests: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
Hi everyone. I added one line of css in the main.css file, then undid that one line, and now my blog template is unlinked from the main.css file. Has anyone run into this? Thanks

Hello Everyone,
I'm a web developer at a company that currently uses HubSpot to build a website
We want to set up a workflow where our design manager files are managed by a git repository
the thing is, i cant seem to find a way to create a sandbox account that keeps the website content (like pages) that would allow us to test our code in a conditions close to the actual production, It wouldnt make any sense to blindfoldedly edit code, we might as well keep using the design manager.
Is there a way to have a real dev environment, with the website content, we could test code changes on on the impacted pages before setting up a Git CI/CD workflow ?

Not at this time. Best workaround right now is having some placeholder content (either lorem ipsum, or pulled from the production portal via API) in the sandbox portal to demo your content with.

Easy transfer of CMS dependancies like pages, CTAs, forms and more between sandbox and production environments is a feature we would love to see as well.

Hi all,
i have a question about the blog.
At the moment our blog is at <http://blog.website.com|blog.website.com> . is it possible to transfer the blog to be <http://website.com/blog|website.com/blog> ?
